text: [jazzy music]
- Hi, I'm Seth MacFarlane,

and welcome to the Peacock
"At-Home Variety Show."

We're here to help
raise awareness and support

for essential workers
and communities in need

through great organizations
like Americares,

helping to protect
frontline workers

in the U.S.
and around the world.
So what's in store for tonight?

Well, it's the same
as last night,

except our audience
is 5 pounds heavier.

Anyway, we do this little
variety show

every evening at 7:00 p.m.
because that's when people

pay tribute
to our health care workers

by banging pots and pans
together,

and everyone loves this...
except dogs.
Dogs hate it.

7:00 p.m.
is like their 9/11.

Now, tonight we have two guests
who you may know

from the Seth Meyers
late-night segment
"Jokes Seth Can't Tell,"

of which I, myself,
also have a very thick file.

These two are both talented
and hilarious,

which I think we all need
right now,

because laughter
is the best medicine,

aside from, you know,
medicine.

So here they are to give you
a dose of comedy remdesivir:

Amber Ruffin
and Jenny Hagel.
- Thank you, Seth.

These days,
we're inundated with news
about what's going on outside.

- But what about
what's going on inside?
- I'm Amber Ruffin.
- I'm Jenny Hagel,
and this is "Apartment News."
[dramatic music]
- Tonight's top story:
this avocado used to be hard.
Now it's a little less hard.
Back to you, Jenny.

- Also one of our top stories
tonight--

authorities in New York
are searching
for a missing remote control.

The remote was last seen
Tuesday at 1:00 a.m.
in this living room.

If you have any information
 as to the whereabouts
of this remote,

please call the number
 on your screen.

There is a ten bajillion dollar
reward.
- And in a tragic story,

last night a spider was killed
in the bathroom.
The murderer is still at large.
- That's it for local news.

Now let's take a look
at international news.
This pasta's from Italy.
This olive oil is from Spain.

And this tequila
is from Mexico.
Amber?
- Thank you, Jenny.

Let's take a look
at the weather.
It's hot in here,
but it's cold in here.
Now to Jenny with sports.

- It's been a big week
for sports.
Let's check out the highlights.
[energetic music]
And now to Amber with traffic.
[dramatic music]
- I saw a car!
- In entertainment news...
this neighbor hates
this neighbor.

And now to Amber with some
breaking news.
- This just in: the mail.

- That's all the time we have
for tonight.

Join us tomorrow for our
hard-hitting exposé:

"What's That Smell
in the Fridge?"
Until then, I'm Jenny Hagel.
- I'm Amber Ruffin,

and this has been
"Apartment News."
[dramatic music]
[jazzy music]

- Hey, everybody,
I'm Dr. Terry Dubrow.
- And I'm Dr. Paul Nassif.

- If you've watched our show
"Botched,"

you know that
from time to time,
we like to roast each other.

- You gotta have hair
like a--

you gotta have hair
like a man.

- Yeah, but you're,
like, simian.

- This is normal hair.
- On the evolutionary scale,

you're not this dude;
you're this dude.

You like to work out
first thing in the morning.

- I like working out
around 5:30 to get out.

- How can you get
your heart rate up at--
although when you work out,

your heart rate doesn't
really go up, does it?

Well, I guess it's me
who mainly likes to roast Paul.
- Of course. What else is new?

But today
we're gonna do something
a little bit different.

We'll be roasting each other
for a great cause.
- That's right.

We're gonna go back and forth
trading insults.

Every time I make Paul laugh
or he makes me laugh,

Peacock is gonna make
a donation to Americares.

- A great charity
that provides supplies

and other critical resources
for frontline health workers.
This is gonna be fun.
- ♪ I wanna be perfect ♪

- All right, I'll go first.
All right?

- Yeah, of course, as usual.
You always go first.

- Okay.
You always say you work out,

but the only thing
you've ever lifted
is your face.
[both laughing]
You go.
- Hey, Terry,
I see your hairline decided

to socially distance itself
from the rest of your face.
- [laughs]

- All right.
Go ahead, Terry.

- You're not gonna like these,
but these are good.

You've had so many
nose jobs,

your nose
has its own résumé.
- [laughs]
- [giggles]
- That was cute.

- Your young wife is pregnant,
and that's fantastic.

The only question is,
will your baby's first words

be "mama"
or "grandpa"?
- [laughs]

You're so old,
you preordered the Bible.
- [laughs]

- I like that one.
There we go, buddy.

- Your back is so hairy,
if you lit one of your farts,
you'd start a brush fire.
- [laughing]
[clapping]

- Paul, you are really
handsome.

In fact, you're living proof
that Ron Jeremy
had sex with Saddam Hussein.
[both laughing]

- Of course, there's no way
I thought you'd use that.
But that is good, though.
[clapping]
[light music]
- That was really fun.

And by the way, Paul, you know
I didn't mean any of that.
You know I love you.

- I know you love me, but you
constantly make fun of me.

But I will tell you something.
It was amazing.
Terry, guess what.

We just raised $10,000
for Americares.

- We really want to extend
a special thank you

to all those first responders
and essential workers out there

making it a safer world
for all of us.

- And of course all the doctors
and nurses on the front lines.

Everything that you guys
are doing for us,

we love you,
and please, stay safe.

- Bye, everyone.
- Bye-bye.
Take care.
[upbeat music]
